content.description: This is a pretty nice wide crack is located around the corner from the other routes. Although I remember climbing it the details are sketchy. What I do remember was tossing quite a few rocks out of the crack as I made my way up. This could probably clean up nicely.
content.location: Right side of the area around a corner and about 50ft uphill from the other routes. I'd almost forgotten about this one untill I recently walked the area again.

content.description: Climb crux moves past a bolt and continue up cracks to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: One bolt and mostly finger sized gear I think
content.location: Left side of cliff, a low bolt leads to corners.

content.description: There is no gear for about the first 1/3 untill after the crux is encountered. Exhilarating! This endeavor climbs the face right of Why Crack. There is no gear for the first section untill a shallow crack. The crack gets better towards the top. You can probably lower from Why Crack although I originally continued up to trees.
content.location: Right of why crack. This route starts up a short corner

content.description: We had climbed this prior to learning how to properly develop climbing routes. That said there may still be some loose rock at the beginning of this one. Great climb though! Climb easy rock to below the y shaped crack. Place a big cam (#3 or maybe #4) then pull out onto the face and crack above. Bolted anchor but no hardware
A small hidden crag that's home to a couple of nice climbs.
